results.title: An Idea takes shape
results.creator_credit: Thomas Friedman, John Williams, Andrew Liebman, Stephen Segaller and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Columbus and the age of discovery”.
Beginning with the 1992 project to recreate the ships used by Columbus on his famous voyage of discovery, this episode takes us through the period of preparation preceding Columbus’ voyage - the reason behind the development of his belief that Cathay (China) could be reached by sailing west rather than east; his training in maritime cartography in Lisbon; and his voyage to Portuguese west Africa where he experienced first hand the fabulous wealth possible from the gold and slave trades. Undeterred by the Portuguese king’s rejection of his proposal for the voyage west, Columbus turned to the Spanish throne to fund his dream.

results.title: An Hour from London
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”
Depicts the great variety of scenery and historical landmarks near to London. By road one can go to East Anglia; by rail to Brighton; by boat to Henley, Oxford, Windsor Castle and Hampton Court. Down the Thames at Greenwich are mementos of Lord Nelson and Samuel Pepys.

results.title: An Eye for the job
results.creator_credit: Kevin Sim, Nigel Miller and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Discovery”.
A documentary about the quiet revolution in the operating theatre. The surgeon has now harnessed his skills to the microscope, and operations of the most minute detail are achieved with microsurgery. Depicts five case studies - a blind painter is made to see again, a deaf grandmother can hear again, a worker’s torn off hand is restored, a man’s severed thumb is replaced by his big toe, and a young woman has her fallopian tubes untied.

results.title: An Eye for business
results.brief_description: Shows how ideas and design are converted into computer language and how the “light pen” has enabled the engineer or designer to communicate with a computer in his own terms-pictorially-by the technique of computer graphics.

results.title: An Experiment in towns
results.creator_credit: Anthony Gilkison, Rayant Pictures and John Reeve
results.brief_description: Shows the reasons why Britain has recently built fifteen towns - to give healthier working conditions, closer proximity to work, and enable “men to lunch in their own homes”. Explains how the planned towns are designed to allow safe play for children and creative leisure for adults. Shows the good design of individual homes.

results.title: An Expedition into a volcano
results.brief_description: An expedition to Mount Nyiragongo, 11,000 feet above sea level - one of a chain of volcanoes in central East Africa. The expedition descends, terrace by terrace, to the lake of lava. Animated diagrams illustrate volcanic activity, then close shots of the lake show the mobility of molten lava, the formation of rocks, the burning of volcanic gases.

results.title: An Everyday miracle
results.brief_description: Shows the use of ultrasound and microphotography to determine intra uterine health from conception to birth. Narrated by Sir David Attenborough, this documentary has incredible shots of the developing foetus.

results.title: An Evening with Charles Aznavour
results.creator_credit: VCL Communications, Phillip Goodhand, Patrick Shart and Mike Mansfield
results.brief_description: This is a video-taped program of the internationally acclaimed French singer/actor, Charles Aznavour, performing live at the Duke of York’s Theatre, London in 1982. The charming and entertaining Aznavour performs a selection of his popular songs accompanied by The Wren Orchestra, and vocal accompaniment from Sue Martin, Val Stokes and Lavinia Rogers. Musical direction by Peter Lee.

results.title: An Essay: the popular arts today
results.creator_credit: Saul Bass Films, Elaine Bass, Jim Ragan and Saul Bass
results.brief_description: A vignette on popular arts in America through the use of live-action, animation and special effects. Portrays Hollywood movies as a nightmare realm of casual predation and fatuous pomposity. Focuses also on comic book heros, television, music, books and magazines.
